basics.name: Aditi Jaiswal
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a Master's in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2022.

education.institution: Sardar Vallabhbhai National Institute of Technology, Surat, India

work.summary: Using Deep learning for physics and atmospheric science
highlights: Posterior sampling of Galactic Cosmic Radiations: used the observed data, obtained from the AMS satellite from International Space Station, to train a neural network surrogate model and use Markov Chain Monte Carlo method to do posterior sampling over the model parameters (used JAX, TensorFlow)

Deep learning to predict cut-off lows: Using 20th century atmospheric data (surface pressure) to understand the randomness of these cut-off lows and predict their direction to help with weather forecasting

work.summary: Spring 2021 and Summer 2021 Graduate Teaching Assistant (ICS311- Algorithms)
highlights: Help students with in-class problems and homework assignments
Assist with curriculum development and instruction of classes

work.company: European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN), Geneva, Switzerland
work.summary: Master thesis on Search for Heavy Neutral Leptons using displaced vertex signature
highlights: Data analysis to validate the hadron multiplicity in semi-leptonic decay of HNL using C++, Root and Pythia
Studied the data in ATLAS environment while looking out for various parameters and object reconstruction methods using Athena (ATLAS offline computing software framework

work.company: Bhabha Atomic Research Centre, Mumbai, India
work.summary: Summer internship on the topic: Measuring elastic scattering cross- sections of multiple channels in 7Li+120Sn and 12C+120Sn nuclear reactions at different beam energies
highlights: Energy of residual (Sn) and projectile (Li and C) was used, at different incident energy, in a beam hall experiment to study the reaction cross-section
Wood-Saxon potential was calculated to measure elastic scattering using Fresco (a program  to perform coupled-reaction channels calculations in nuclear physics)

work.company: Udaipur Solar Observatory, PRL, Udaipur, India
work.summary: Analysis of solar images of H-alpha and G-Band spectrum taken by Multi Application Solar Telescope (MAST) and velocity shift measurements in Calcium line in chromosphere
highlights: Processed raw FITS images using IDL (Interactive Data Language) to study the Doppler shifts from the chromospheric lines
